boardgame.name: Races of the Expanse
boardgame.description:
Races of the Expanse is a game of creating an alien race, or human variant race by shuffling multiple decks of cards together, and then using your race to explore and colonize the Expanse of space between the Orion Spur and the Sagitarius arm. We plan to bring the game to Kickstarter this Fall. In Races of the Expanse each player takes turns picking a deck for their base creature, such as Crystaline, Humanoid, Crustacians, or Octopoids, Then in reverse order players choose a special ability Deck from clairvoyant, aquatic, subterranean, or creative. Your random homeworld will then add a regional events deck. These three decks will be Shuffled together, to form your races play deck. Extra races and abilities are planned as stretch goals. finally a communal planets deck is built based on the number of players. Play proceeds clockwise from a random start player.
All players start with a hand of five cards. Player 1 plays up to two cards, and then draws two cards, unless affected by cards or special abilities. Players may have no more than 10 cards in their hand. If, after drawing, you have more than ten cards, discard until you have only ten. If a player runs out of cards in their deck they shuffle their discarded cards and start the deck fresh. Play moves clockwise until the last planet is drawn. (Planets can only be drawn when Explorers are played.) When the last planet is drawn, each player gets one last turn, and then the game is ended and a winner is decided.
The player with the most resource at the end of the game is the winner. You get resource by having the most population on a planet. If two or more players have an equal amount of population on a planet, nobody gets the resource for that planet. The max population of a planet is in the upper lefthand corner of the planet card, the resource of that planet is in the lower righthand corner of the planet card.

boardgame.name: Villainous Intent: 50 Plot Seeds for Superhero Roleplaying
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Villainous Intent: 50 Plot Seeds for Superhero Roleplaying is a handy resource for players and GMs looking to spice up their campaign with sinister schemes and cunning capers. The plots range from star-spanning to street-level, and there are plenty of NPCs (good and evil) who can become part of your group's recurring storyline.

These plot seeds are system-neutral, so they can be used with everything from Mutants & Masterminds to your homebrewed superhero campaign. It's as easy as picking an idea, generating a few stats, and watching your heroes rush off to save the day. And since each entry can easily last an entire session, you're getting 50 weeks of entertainment--almost a full year--for less than the cost of a muffin at Starbucks.

boardgame.name: Bulletproof Blues
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:
Welcome to Bulletproof Blues: a “rules light” superhero roleplaying game set in the universe of Kalos Comics. If you’ve seen any of the Spider-Man, Batman, or Kick-Ass movies, you know what a superhero is: an individual with great determination who chooses to use their abilities to make the world a better place. And, of course, everyone is familiar with Kalos Comics.

The Kalos Universe
Bulletproof Blues takes place in the world-famous universe of Kalos Comics, creators of Paragon (who first appeared in Amazing Adventure Magazine in 1938), Rook (who first appeared in Tales Of Mystery in 1939), Antiope, Doctor Arcane, and the rest of the Justifiers, as well as sinister organizations like Aegis and GORGON, and mysterious entities like The Bride. From the ancient ruins of Lemuria to the far reaches of the Hausdorff Dimension, the Kalos Universe is now yours to explore. If you are unfamiliar with the Kalos Universe, you will find more information in the World chapter.

boardgame.name: Help Wanted
boardgame.description:
Help Wanted is an adult party game in which players compete against each other to see who can provide the best solution for another player’s problem. Help Wanted includes a lot of different problems to solve ranging from the ridiculous to the apocalyptic. To solve these problems, players will have over 400 different solution cards, for a grand total of over 500 cards. Add in the human elements of interpretation and presentation and the possibilities are infinite!

With similar party games you find yourself playing one artless card, face down, in secret while a judge chooses their favorite and leaves you wondering about their logic when your card was (clearly) the best choice. You find yourself arguing your point and explaining that everyone else is (clearly) dumb, but the decision has already been made. Bummer!

With Help Wanted you still want the judge to choose you, but you have the opportunity to weave together a short narrative to state your case by combining up to three different Solution Cards and wooing the judge with your keen intellect.

boardgame.name: Threshold: Tragic Superheroes
boardgame.description:
Simple mechanics. Fast action. Narrative elements in the control of the players. Threshold: Tragic Superheroes is a fun, super-fast game of superhero action. But, that's not all it has. Threshold: Tragic Superheroes explores what it is to be at the end of your rope, but in a way to empower you in that exploraion.

In Threshold: Tragic Superheroes, you take on the role of a person who is dying; someone who has little time left among the living. Yet, even during this dark time, there is a glimmer of hope. A mysterious company, Speed Silver, has given your character a drug, the Elixir. This high-tech drug invades the character's body and grants superhuman abilities previously unknown among the modern human race. While the Elixir may prove more lethal to the character than their terminal illness, it does allow them to get out and experience life in their last few days and weeks.

The system powering Threshold: Tragic Superheroes is fast and loose, using three attributes, Physical, Mental and Social, to represent your character's strengths and weaknesses. Combining this with the character's Regret and Vice, these simple mechanics allow each group to tell intense stories where each person sitting at the table is part Actor and Director, injecting their own vision into the scene and incorporating it all into one glorious story.

boardgame.name: Canalis
boardgame.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the wake of one of Tempest's namesake storms, a new area near the city-state has opened up for development. Your faction looks to you to carve out your power in this new area.

Place canals to connect your buildings to resources and to the harbor. Ensure the peasantry looks to you for employment. Improve the prestige of your work by placing scenic gardens. And wouldn't the Senate Annex look most aesthetically pleasing right there, where it completely blocks the view of your opponent's building?

Canalis is a game of building a new district in the City-State of Tempest, arranging the canals and placing buildings in such a manner as to benefit you the most. Players use a mixture of card drafting and tile laying to build the district, and each player's secret missions keep the outcome in doubt until the last card is played.

listing.notes:
All games are new and in their original wrapping and all prices include the German VAT (7% or 19%).
We offer only goods that we have in stock.
We ship worldwide – please ask for a quote about exact shipping costs (rest assured that we always try to keep them as low as possible).
Payment may be made by Paypal or bank transfer in advance.
For orders above €50 we grant a discount of €5 on shipping costs.
If you have any questions, feel free to send us an email (laden@gamers-hq.de), give us a call (+49 30 79706126) or visit our homepage (www.gamers-hq.de).
Our Terms and Conditions
1. General
All transactions between Gamers HQ and you, the customer, are subject to the following conditions, which you acknowledge by accepting delivery of your ordered products. These conditions do not affect your statutory rights and in all cases German law applies.
2. Orders and prices
We do our level best to ensure that the information on our website is up-to-date. Please note that offers and prices are subject to change. We work to ensure that our prices are all correct, but cannot be held responsible for accidentally displaying the wrong price of a product.
All prices are quoted in Euros and already include all necessary taxes.
3. Lead times and delivery costs
Our products are delivered directly from our Berlin base, and orders are usually dispatched within two working days. Dispatch and transport are at the expense of the customer. We usually ship orders with DHL but explicitly reserve the right to choose another method of transport. If an order is split into several deliveries, each delivery counts as a separate transaction.
Delivery within Germany is free of charge if your order amounts to a total of 50 euros or more. Below that amount, we charge a one-off fee of 5 euros.
Our products can also be ordered for delivery outside Germany. In that case, an estimate of the delivery costs is added to your order during checkout. Please note that this delivery cost estimate does not necessarily constitute the final amount. We shall contact you personally by email after you have placed your order to present you with delivery options and to quote the final price for delivery costs.
4. Payment options
We currently offer the following three payment options: direct debit from your bank account (only within Germany), bank transfer (prepayment) and PayPal. Once you have placed three orders, we also offer you the option to pay by invoice. Such privileges can, however, be withdrawn should we encounter repeated delays in settling invoices.
5. Cancellations, Refunds & Returns Should you wish to cancel your order, you can do so by notifying us by fax, email, letter or by simply returning your product(s) to Gamers HQ. No questions asked. Please note that such a cancellation has to be done within two weeks after having received your ordered product(s). Should you have already paid for your order, we shall refund those costs to you as soon as we have received your cancellation notification. Please ensure that any products returned are in good condition. If you check the products in a manner that you will have done, for example, in a shop, this is fine. Any other handling of the product(s) might entitle Gamers HQ to some compensation from you, which might in rare cases amount to the original sum paid for the product(s). So should you feel that you might cancel your order by returning the products, please limit your inspection of the products to optical checks and do not use them on a regular basis. If you return your order within two weeks in the above manner, we shall refund you the costs for sending the product(s) back to us (unless your cancelled order amounts less than 20 euros, in which case you as the customer will bear the cost of return postage). Please ensure that you use appropriate packing material when sending back the product(s) — preferably using the original wrapping. Please note that German law, following the EU directive 97/7/EG of 20 May 1997, specifies that the right to return items and receive a full refund is not applicable to the purchase of newspapers, magazines or journals (§312d BGB) as well as the purchase of audio- or video-recordings and software once you have broken the seal of the package. Should we accidently send you the wrong products, please return them to us and we shall refund you the return postage immediately. Any cancellation of an order has to be done in writing (by post, fax or email). 6. Ownership
Please note that ordered products remain our property until you have fully paid for them.
7. Personal data
We are committed to protecting your personal information and will keep the information you entrust to us safely and securely. We may collect information from you to monitor website visitor patterns, so that we can improve our website. We also collect information from you to handle orders, deliver products and services, process payments, communicate with you about orders, products and services, update our records and generally maintain your customer profile with us. However, we shall never sell or share your personal information with third parties. Our customer data — in so far as required to provide the above services and within the limits defined by the data protection laws of Germany (paragraph 26 BDSG) — is saved and handled on a separate, network-independent computer.
8. Other matters
We reserve the right to reject orders without any explanation. Also please note that you as a customer cannot assert a claim against Gamers HQ if, for whatever reason, we are unable to source the item(s) you have ordered. Such cases arise only very exceptionally; we try to ensure that everything we advertise in our web shop is in stock. Where, for whatever reason, we are unable to deliver we promptly refund in full everything you have paid.
9. Limitation of liability: external links
Although we check the content of external links provided on our website, we have no control over or responsibility for these domains to which we provide the links or which link to us. That responsibility solely rests with those who manage the respective domains.
10. Place of jurisdiction
Any disputes arising hereunder will be settled before a Berlin court. We reserve the right to choose the customer's place of jurisdiction instead.
11. Severability clause
If parts of these terms and conditions become ineffective, the remainder of these terms still apply.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Dwellers
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Dwellers is a fantasy adventure card game that requires strategy, cooperation, and cunning. This game is recommended for 2-4 players. Each player will take on the role of an adventurer seeking gold. Along the way, adventurers will gain treasure, magic items, abilities, and level increases by defeating monsters within the dungeon. The winner will be the player who collects the most gold at the end of the game.

To play, each player selects a Character (Rogue, Priest, Mage, and Fighter). All Characters have their own special ability, weapons, armor and item cards. Players will build a 30-card deck, also called the Energy Deck, with these cards. The deck will be used to power abilities, do damage to monster and will also be used to gain additional treasure, in the form of gold cards, or items and abilities to put into active play.

Players then take turns using their abilities and weapons to cause damage and collect experience points from monsters. Players will use their energy deck throughout the game, but if they spend too much energy, they might not have enough to survive the final boss. Can your party work together and survive the dungeon or feel the agony of defeat. In the end there can be only one winner and that is the player with the most gold.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Fighter: Feu à volonté
Dungeon Fighter: Feuer frei!
Dungeon Fighter: Fire at Will
Dungeon Fighter: Fogo Neles!
Dungeon Fighter: Fuoco a Volontà
boardgame.description: Dungeon Fighter: Fire at Will! is the first of four expansions for use with Dungeon Fighter, each themed to one of the four elements: air, earth, water and fire. In addition to adding new monsters, new weapons, new items and new armor, each expansion introduces a new game mechanism and three new ways to complicate your ability to throw dice at the targets on the game board. With this expansion, fire, you need to throw the die through a "burning" ring of fire held in the air. You might also need to bounce a die through a gate, toss three dice held in a row, or roll a die down a board and bounce it onto a target. The goal remains the same as the base game, survive the dungeon and defeat the boss!!

boardgame.name: Face Friend
瘋狂交友
boardgame.description:
Face Friend is a lovely party game. Players will add friends just like what they have done in Facebook. The more they add friends, the higher marks they get in the game. The highest total friend cards score is the Winner.

The game is turn-based.
1. Play an action card
2. Can have different option:
(a) select one unrevealed card from common area to their own collection; or
(b) pick up one revealed card from common area to their own collection.
(c) end turn and pass to the left player.

Players cannot skip their turn on collecting friend card.


When friend cards exhaused in common area, the round ends and start a new round. The game ends after three game round has completed. The highest total friend cards score is the Winner.

boardgame.name: Elevenses
Elevenses: The Special Guests
boardgame.description:
Elevenses is a card game in which respectable 1920s socialites strive to serve the finest morning teas!

Each player starts the round with an identical set of eleven morning tea cards. Each card has a point value as well a special action which must be carried out when it is played. The lower the point value of a card, the better its power. The powers lead to surprising interactions between the players! Cards must also be played to a specific position on the table. Whenever a card is played, in most cases you pick up the card that was previously in its position, requiring you to plan your morning tea carefully!

The round ends when a player plays the "Elevenses" card. It's time for tea! The players compare the value of their cards. Points are awarded to the highest scoring morning teas. The game continues until a player has 7 or more points. She has served the finest morning teas of all and wins the game!

The six-card expansion Elevenses: The Special Guests is included in the game. With this expansion, each player is dealt one special guest card in secret at the start of each round. Each guest will come to your morning tea only if you serve certain things. If you play the right combination of morning tea cards, the guest arrives, you reveal the card, and your morning tea goes up in value!

Game #2 in 'The Mike Line' of games from Grail Games.

boardgame.name: Revolver 2.1: Zadeltassen vol ellende
Revolver Expansion 2.1: The Savage Guns
boardgame.description:
Four new savage gunfighters ride into battle, lured by Mapache’s ill-gotten wealth and promises of power. For a fistful of Pesos, these lawbreakers join the self-styled general and wait to do his sinful bidding. Stood firmly against these desperadoes are a gang of cowpunchers, card sharks, and one-time outlaws – marshalled to help the cause by the commendable Padre.

Combine this expansion with the base game to explore new tactics and strategies and define your own play style.

This expansion develops a new unique set of guardians to flesh out the crew that the Padre player recruits to combat 'General Mapache' - giving your games more replayability and adventure. No longer can the devious Mexican rely as heavily on his gatling gun for victory - his world is about to be shaken up!

Revolver 2: The Savage Guns also includes four cutthroat lieutenants for the 'General' to muster - who are tougher and nastier than anything the Padre has ever had to confront before. Paid in combinations of Pesos and Mexican Army tokens, these gunslingers add variety to the experience - each also 'carrying' a clutch of saddlebag drafting cards.

Determined to fight for the township of Malpaso like a cornered Kilkenny cat, the Padre has a few other tricks up his sleeve: he can arm and train the Malpaso menfolk into a rudimentary fighting force; and set up a bastion at the town's chapel.

boardgame.name: Loops
boardgame.description:
A very simple game that you could play with Xs and Os. It's certainly related to Go but has much simpler rules, and while definitely not as "deep", it can still produce some interesting competition.

The best board for beginners is probably 7x7x7, maybe 6x6x6.

The rules are explained here: http://www.scribd.com/doc/287823949/Loops

Here are a bunch of interesting variations: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1286815/variants

You can also change things up by playing with two moves per turn and/or the ability to place either side's color each move. The easiest way for beginners to account for pie while playing with two moves per turn is by playing only a single move on the very first turn.

This pack contains survivors Eagle Chaz (The American Hero), Troy (The Traveller), and The Cardboard Tube Samurai. This pack also contains the Zomb'ivors of those survivors as well as Zomb'ivors of Dave, El Cholo, and Nick.

Eagle Chaz is THE man. He fought crime and evil. He fought for freedom, he stood for the weak against the powerful. He knows how to use guns but his body is his best weapon. boardgame.name: Heart Attack or Escape from the Old Folks Home
boardgame.description:
You are an “Old Folk” whose evil children have placed into a retirement home. One night after an average day you drift off to sleep as usual. In the morning you are awakened by the loudspeaker system, this is very much not usual. It appears to be a recording. A young insulting voice is outlining the victory, which his group achieved overnight. You realize he is part of the youth movement, which has been threatening the establishment, as usual. The voice declares that they have taken over the government and the first new law has been set into motion is nobody over the age of 30 is worthy of life. However, the law had been quickly modified to allow for one “Old Folk”, as they are to be called, to be allowed to live per retirement home. The first Old Folk to make his or her way out of the home will receive the pardon for life. Be aware however, the entire home has been booby trapped and there will be no medical teams sent in to help the fallen. The recording starts again.

Victory Conditions:
Players should agree to a victory point total before play begins, 20 points is a short game, 30 average and 40 long. Points are scored

How to score points:
After playing some room cards you may play a Passkey. This will do two things, 1) will allow you to move to another Quad if you wish to. Once the points are calculated the scorekeeper should note the player's new score and announce to all players what the score is. There are four scoring positions, position one, two, three, and four. The first room you play is in “Position One”, the next card your play will be in “Position Two”, then next “Position Three” and finally the fourth in “Position Four”.

boardgame.name: Supers Unleashed
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Supers Unleashed is a rules lite superhero RPG that will allow you to create any super powered hero that you can imagine or recreate your favorite comic book superhero. With 171 super powers to choose from, you can create any hero imaginable. This flexible system allows you to design any weapon or vehicle simply by assigning Powers to them. It includes lists of ideas that will help make your superheroes or super villans unique and exciting. Supers Unleashed also comes with many adventure hooks that will help get you right into the action.

Each super team should be composed of heroes that each fill a role to create a balanced and powerful force. Brutes have indestructible bodies and super strength. Speedsters use their speed of light movement to control the battlefield. Blaster uses their long range powers to wreck havok. Steel Warriors use their advanced power armor to dominate their enemies. Changelings transform their bodies to defeat any foe. Mentalists use the power of their minds to protect the innocent.

boardgame.name: Future Heroes (Extreme Future)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
In the extreme future, the galaxy is a crowded place. There are thousands of inhabited worlds and intelligent species, and very few of them get along with each other. But there are pockets of order and peace.
One of these areas is called the Core Worlds, and it must be forever on guard against alien attack, elder creatures, supervillains, robots run amok, and many other threats. The Core Worlds however are protected by a valiant group of superheroes, and they use their incredible powers to defend their future civilization.

Future Heroes is a role-playing game designed to simulate a superhero comic book world, where the heroes are based in the extreme future, fighting against a future backdrop of spaceships, robots and superscience.

Future Heroes has an innovative split between abilities and powers. All heroes have a single ability type, and all their individual powers are derived from this. As the superhero progresses and gains experience they can increase the effectiveness of their powers and gain entirely new powers by training and focusing their ability.

Powers are defined by the effect they have, so an energy blast is the same power, regardless of whether it represents a laser beam, ice powers, or lightning. This simple system allows superheroes to be quickly designed, but be every bit as complex and interesting as the heroes of the comic books. So take a look, and blast into a future fit for a superhero.

boardgame.name: Heroes in Time
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Heroes in Time is a generic system that nevertheless comes with a huge range of settings, all tied together by a time traveling/ alternate histories theme.

The conceit of the game is that characters will be recruited from across the timeline of the game world. They will range from primeval barbarians, through fantasy elves, swashbuckling pirates, steampunk adventurers, modern investigators, super spies, and cyberpunk operatives, to the psionic knights of space opera.

All these different types of warriors will be recruited by an enigmatic group of Temporal Guardians and all working together on the same team, ready to be deployed to any point in history.

So get Heroes in Time and start adventuring through the whole of history

From the introduction:
Philosophy
The idea of this game is to provide everything needed to play any genre in one place – with the same setting so characters can travel backwards and forwards through time.

Introduction
This RPG is the core system for the ‘Heroes in Time’ or ‘HiT’ role-playing game. The system uses percentile dice for most rolls, but it also uses six-sided dice here and there too.

boardgame.name: Resolute: Legacy
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The wind billows your cape. It's truly beautiful up here above the sky. You rarely get to notice anymore. The lush cloud tops spread out before you. The sun warms your face. You wish it could stay this way forever... or even for a few hours. But it cannot. Squaring your jaw, you turn downward, falling to earth. Under the clouds, the city waits. A fire burns in the north ward. The bank's familiar alarm chimes in the east. Far off on the water, something rises from the deep.

Your legacy calls.

Resolute: Legacy is the latest version of the Resolute game system. The little game of big adventure gives you all you need to create supers ranging from street-level brawlers to earth-shaking titans, and everything in between.

This revised, streamlined and intuitive superhero system features:
• A single D12 (or optional 2D6) dice mechanic for all action resolution.
• Complete rules for building all types of superhero characters, including detailed listings of over 60 abilities, and rules for customizing your abilities to fit your character concept.
• Rules for superhero-scale combat. If you want to pick up a car and throw it at a foe, project a force field, or crush your opponent in your bare hands, Resolute allows you to do it.
• A simple bonus system that scales all the way from characters who can barely lift 50 lbs. to those who can lift in excess of 500 tons.
• An evocative backdrop that provides seeds for ongoing campaigns, 12 adventure hooks, and rules for character advancement and refereeing the game.
• Rules for vehicles the supers can purchase and use.
